createAMessage.name: createAMessage
createAMessage.label: Create a Prompt

expect.help: The model that will complete your prompt.
expect.name: model
expect.label: Model

expect.help: The maximum number of tokens to generate before stopping.
expect.name: max_tokens
expect.label: Max Tokens

expect.help: Input messages. The first message must always use the `user` role. Roles must alternate.
expect.name: messages

spec.help: For models that support image content blocks (vision), see the [Anthropic model comparison table](https://docs.anthropic.com/en/docs/about-claude/models#model-comparison-table).
spec.name: type
spec.label: Type

nested.help: Content of the message on behalf of the selected **Role** .
nested.name: text
nested.label: Text

spec.help: File name, including the extension, for example, `image.jpg`.
spec.name: filename
spec.label: Filename

spec.help: Binary data of the image. For example, you can retrieve the binary data of your image using the **HTTP: Get a file** module.
spec.name: data
spec.label: Data

nested.help: If the request ends with an assistant turn, then the response content will continue directly from that last turn.
nested.name: content
nested.label: Content

spec.help: You can send image content blocks starting with Claude 3 models.
spec.name: type
spec.label: Type

nested.help: Content of the message on behalf of the selected **Role** .
nested.name: text
nested.label: Text

expect.label: Messages

expect.help: A system prompt is a way of providing context and instructions. For more information about System prompts, see the [Anthropic Claude System prompts guide](https://docs.anthropic.com/claude/docs/how-to-use-system-prompts).
expect.name: system
expect.label: System Prompt

expect.help: An object describing metadata about the request.
expect.name: metadata

spec.help: An external identifier for the user who is associated with the request.
spec.name: user_id
spec.label: User ID

expect.label: Metadata

expect.help: Custom text sequences that will cause the model to stop generating.
expect.name: stop_sequences
expect.label: Stop Sequences

expect.help:
Higher temperatures generate more creative and generative responses. For example, `0.8`. Lower temperatures generate more analytical /multiple-choice responses. For example, `0.2`.
The default value is `1`.
expect.name: temperature
expect.label: Temperature

expect.help: Probability value to compute the cumulative distribution over all options for each subsequent token. Computed in decreasing probability order until this value is reached. You should alter **Temperature** or **Top P** , but not both.
expect.name: top_p
expect.label: Top P

expect.help: Used to remove `long tail` low probability responses.
expect.name: top_k
expect.label: Top K

expect.help: Additional parameters to use. For a complete list of parameters, see the [Anthropic API Reference](https://docs.anthropic.com/en/api/messages).
expect.name: additionalParameters
expect.label: Other Input Parameters

createAMessage.description: Creates a new prompt based on a structured list of input messages.

createACompletion.name: createACompletion
createACompletion.label: Create a Chat Completion (Legacy)

expect.help:
The model that will complete your prompt.
This module supports only legacy models and will not be compatible with future models and features. We recommend migrating to **Create a Prompt** module.
expect.name: model
expect.label: Model

expect.help: The prompt that you want Claude to complete.
expect.name: prompt
expect.label: Prompt

expect.help:
The maximum number of tokens to generate before stopping.
Note that Anthropic models may stop before reaching this maximum. This parameter only specifies the absolute maximum number of tokens to generate.
expect.name: max_tokens_to_sample
expect.label: Max Tokens to Sample

expect.help: Sequences that will cause the model to stop generating completion text. Anthropic models stop on "\n\nHuman:", and may include additional built-in stop sequences in the future. By providing the `Stop Sequences` parameter, you may include additional strings that will cause the model to stop generating.
expect.name: stop_sequences
expect.label: Stop Sequences

expect.help:
Amount of randomness injected into the response.
Defaults to `1`. Ranges from `0` to `1`. Use temp closer to `0` for analytical / multiple choice, and closer to `1` for creative and generative tasks.
expect.name: temperature
expect.label: Temperature

expect.help: Nucleus sampling from Anthropic cuts off token options once cumulative probability reaches a specified Top-p. Alter Temperature or Top-p, not both.
expect.name: top_p
expect.label: Top-p

expect.help: Only sample from the top K options for each subsequent token.Used to remove "long tail" low probability responses. [Learn more technical details here](https://towardsdatascience.com/how-to-sample-from-language-models-682bceb97277).
expect.name: top_k
expect.label: Top-k

spec.help:
An external identifier for the user who is associated with the request.
This should be a UUID, hash value, or other opaque identifier. Anthropic may use this ID to help detect abuse. Do not include any identifying information such as name, email address, or phone number.
spec.name: user_id
spec.label: User ID

createACompletion.description: Creates a completion based on the given prompt.

description: Claude is a next-generation AI assistant based on Anthropic's research into training helpful, honest, and harmless AI systems. Safer: with Constitutional AI built in, Claude is designed to reduce brand risk. Best in class data retention, and no training on your data. Cleve: leading the industry with 100K+ token windows, Claude can handle complex multi-step instructions over large amounts of content. Yours: personalize Claude to excel at your use cases and speak in your voice. Make the model work for you.
